abstract: Yahoo’s quarterly filing shows extent of shareholder discontent with board: More than one-third of all shares voted against the reelection of the three directors on its compensation committee.
snippet: Yahoo’s quarterly filing shows extent of shareholder discontent with board: More than one-third of all shares voted against the reelection of the three directors on its compensation committee.
lead_paragraph: The recent history of Yahoo’s troubles is well-known: the company lost the search race to Google; it missed out on key trends — social networking, for instance — and potential acquisitions — Facebook, most notably; its performance disappointed; some shareholders grew restless and focused their anger on a board that gave former CEO Terry Semel one of the richest pay packages in Corporate America.
